Person B: No , I am ok , really .

Person B: I want you to put your hands behind your head ! You are under arrest !
Person A: The taxi drivers are on strike again .
Person B: What for ?
Person A: They want the government to reduce the price of the gasoline .
Person B: It is really a hot potato .
Person A: We've managed to reduce our energy consumption in our factory by about 15 per cent in the last two years .
Person B: That's excellent . How have you managed that ?
Person A: Mainly because we've invested in a heat recovery system .
Person B: What does that mean exactly ?
Person A: Well , we use the exhaust gases from our printing presses to provide energy to heat our dryers .
Person B: What other sources of energy do you use ?
Person A: We don't use any fossil fuels . Most of our power comes from hydro-electric plants . We're hoping to use even more energy from alternative sources in the future - perhaps even wind power .
Person A: Believe it or not , tea is the most popular beverage in the world after water .
Person B: Well , people from Asia to Europe all enjoy tea .
Person A: Right . And China is the homeland of tea .
Person B: Yes , Chinese people love drinking tea so much . Some even claim they can't live without tea .
Person A: Do you know there are several catagories of Chinese tea ?
Person B: Yes , I believe there are green teas , black teas and scented teas . Any Others ?
Person A: Well , have you ever heard of Oulong tea and compressed tea ?
Person B: Oh , yeah . Oulong tea is good for one's health . isn't it ?
Person A: You surely know a lot about Chinese tea .
Person B: Sure , I like drinking tea at teahouses .
Person A: Oh , so do I .
Person B: Why don't we go for one now ?
Person A: Great . We can chat while enjoying a cup there .
Person B: Let's go !
Person A: What are your personal weaknesses ?

Person B: I ' m afraid I ' m a poor talker . I ' m not comfortable talking with the people whom I have just met for the first time . That is not very good for business , so I have been studying public speaking .
Person A: Are you more of a leader or a follower ?
Person B: I don ' t try to lead people . I ' d rather cooperate with everybody , and get the job done by working together .
Person A: Do you think you can make yourself easily understood in English ?
Person B: Yes , in most circumstances .
Person A: Are you available for travel ?
Person B: Yes , I like travelling . I am young , and unmarried . It ' s no problem for me to travel frequently .
Person A: how long will it take us to drive to London ?
Person B: I think it ' s a distance of 180 kilometers from here to London , so it should be a two-hour drive on the motorway .
Person A: that ' s unless there is a traffic jam . It could take three hours .
Person B: you ' re right . We will be able to travel at high speeds at the beginning and end of the journey , because we will be in built-up areas .
Person A: so , shall we allow three hours to cover the distance ?
Person B: ok . You haven ' t seen my company car , have you ?
Person A: no . let me take a look ... it ' s longer than my car .
Person B: I think it ' s over five meters long . I can ' t remember exactly . It has a maximum speed of over 200 kilometers an hour .
Person A: wow ! That ' s fast ! I don ' t think we will be traveling that fast on the motorway .
Person B: we can ' t . if we went that fast , we would break the speed limit .
Person A: So how did I do on my driving test ?
Person B: Do you want the truth ?
Person A: Of course , I do .
Person B: Well , you really didn't do all that well .
Person A: How bad did I do ?
Person B: To be completely honest , you failed your test .
Person A: How ?
Person B: There were a number of reasons .
Person A: What were they ?
Person B: Basically , you just can't drive .
Person A: Can I have another try ?
Person B: You can take it in a couple weeks .
Person A: Good morning . What's the matter with you ?
Person B: Good morning , doctor . I have a terrible headache .
Person A: All right , young man . Tell me how it got started .
Person B: Yesterday I had a runny nose . Now my nose is stuffed up . I have a sore throat . And I ' m afraid I've got a temperature . I feel terrible .
Person A: Don't worry , young man . Lat me give you an examination . First let me take a look at your throat . Open your mouth and say'ah ' .
Person B: Ah .
Person A: Your throat is inflamed . And your tongue is heavily coated . You have all the symptoms of influenza .
Person B: What am I supposed to do then ?
Person A: A good rest is all you need , and drink more water . I'll write you a prescription .
Person B: Thank you very much .

Person A: This position demands a higher writing ability , so please say something about your writing ability .

Person B: Of course . I've loved writing since I was a very little boy . I won the first prize in a national composition contest when I was in middle school . After attending Nanjing University , I never give up writing . My works , such as Father's Tobacco Pipe , Open Air Cinema , The old City were respectively published China Youth Daily , Yangzi Evening News , and New Beijing . During the period of studying for my degrees of master and doctor , I paid more attention to developing my research ability and published several papers . The Impact of Internet in Chinese Political Participation , The Discipline of Remold , The Historical Direction of Chinese Administration Reform , Bribery Cases of Self governance in Chinese Villages are respectively published in Chinese Publish Administration , Beijing Due Xuebao , Theory and Society and Chinese Reform . I joined in Yangzi Evening News to work as a part-time journalist in 2006 . During this period , I've written a lot of comments , which improved my writing ability to a new level , I have full confidence in my writing ability , and I believe I can do the job well .

Person B: Yes , sir . I acted as a secretary in an insurance company .

Person B: Well , to begin with , I would say she needs to be diligent , and the second point is that she has to do a lot of things on her own initiative . Finally , she can make notes in shorthand and types and has the skills in report writing , summary writing , keep minutes at meetings , and so on . Most important of all is that she seems to have a better memory than average .

Person B: I can handle them without any trouble

Person A: Hi , George . I'm going to have a job interview next week . Could you give me some advice ?

Person B: Sure . First of all , it ' s very important for you not to be late . Job interviewers usually don ' t think very highly of a candidate who arrives ten minutes after the appointed time , only to explain that he could not find the place or that there was heavy traffic .
Person A: Yeah , that's very important .
Person B: So you ' d better explore the place the day before and at the same time , look around to see what the employees are wearing . So the next day you will arrive early for the appointment .
Person A: I ' ll try my best to make a good impression on the interviewer .
Person B: That ' s right . You need to create a good image in a limited time , usually about 30 to 45 minutes .
Person A: It ' s always easier to say something than to do it .

Person B: It ' s not too difficult to make a good impression . For example , you should take care to appear well-groomed and modestly dressed . Avoid the extremes of a too elaborate or too casual style . This will put you on the same level as other applicants and make the interviewer consider more important qualifications .
Person A: But I love wearing T-shirts and jeans .

Person B: I advise you not to wear a too casual style when going to an interview . Informal clothes as well as torn jeans and dirty shoes convey the impression that you are not serious about the job , or that you may be casual about your work as you are about your clothes .
Person A: It ' s a pity that I cannot afford more expensive clothes .
Person B: You misunderstood me . Clothes which are too colorful or too expensive suggest that you do not understand what behavior is appropriate for the job , or that you are snobbish or frivolous .
Person A: I know what you mean . I ought to wear right clothes at the right time .
Person B: You got it . Only in this way can you gain the respect of the interviewer and his confidence in your judgement .
Person A: It seems that ' clothes make the man ' .
Person B: It may not be true , but the first and lasting impression of you is determined by your clothes and behavior .
